title: How to Repair a Desk Lamp

steps.headline: Take your lamp apart.
steps.description: You will probably have to take the bottom off of it to get to the nut and washer there.

steps.headline: Get your various parts.
steps.description: You may not need all of them.

steps.headline: Remove all of the central parts of your lamp being repaired.
Push the new cord through the center of your lamp.
steps.description: The cord is stiff enough that you can just push it through using your hands.

steps.headline: Take the exposed wire and wrap it around the two terminals.
Tighten the screws over the wrapped wires on each side.
Start pulling the various sections of the together by tugging on the wire at the bottom of the lamp.
Get a light bulb and plug in your lamp.
steps.description: It should be working fine now.

text: Take your lamp apart. You will probably have to take the bottom off of it to get to the nut and washer there. Get your various parts. You may not need all of them. Remove all of the central parts of your lamp being repaired.  Push the new cord through the center of your lamp. The cord is stiff enough that you can just push it through using your hands. Take the exposed wire and wrap it around the two terminals.  Tighten the screws over the wrapped wires on each side.  Start pulling the various sections of the together by tugging on the wire at the bottom of the lamp.  Get a light bulb and plug in your lamp. It should be working fine now.
